member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellInvokedRoutedEventArgs
member.summary: This parameter is passed to the GazeElement::Invoked event and allows the application to prevent default invocation when the user dwells on a control

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressEventArgs
member.summary: This parameter is passed to the GazeElement.DwellProgressFeedback event. The event is fired to inform the application of the user's progress towards completing dwelling on a control

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressEventArgs.State
member.summary: Gets an enum that reflects the current state of dwell progress

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressEventArgs.Progress
member.summary: Gets a value between 0 and 1 that reflects the fraction of progress towards completing dwell

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressState
member.summary: An enum that reflects the current state of progress towards dwell when a user is focused on a control

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressState.Idle
member.summary: User is not looking at the control

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressState.Fixating
member.summary: Gaze has entered control but we're not yet showing progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressState.Progressing
member.summary: User is continuing to focus on a control with an intent to dwell and invoke

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.DwellProgressState.Complete
member.summary: User has completed dwelling on a control

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeElement
member.summary: Surrogate object attached to controls allowing subscription to per-control gaze events.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeElement.StateChanged
member.summary: This event is fired when the state of the user's gaze on a control has changed

member.name: E:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeElement.Invoked
member.summary: This event is fired when the user completed dwelling on a control and the control is about to be invoked by default. This event is fired to give the application an opportunity to prevent default invocation

member.name: E:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeElement.DwellProgressFeedback
member.summary: This event is fired to inform the application of the progress towards dwell

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetInteraction(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the status of gaze interaction over that particular XAML element.
member.returns: The status of gaze interaction over that particular XAML element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetIsCursorVisible(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets a boolean indicating whether cursor is shown while user is looking at the school.
member.returns: True the cursor is shown while user is looking at the school; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetCursorRadius(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the size of the gaze cursor radius.
member.returns: The size of the gaze cursor radius.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetGazeElement(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the GazeElement associated with an UIElement.
member.returns: The GazeElement associated with an UIElement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetFixationDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the duration for the control to transition from the Enter state to the Fixation state. At this point, a StateChanged event is fired with PointerState set to Fixation. This event should be used to control the earliest visual feedback the application needs to provide to the user about the gaze location. The default is 350ms.
member.returns: Duration for the control to transition from the Enter state to the Fixation state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetDwellDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the duration for the control to transition from the Fixation state to the Dwell state. At this point, a StateChanged event is fired with PointerState set to Dwell. The Enter and Fixation states are typically achieved too rapidly for the user to have much control over. In contrast Dwell is conscious event. This is the point at which the control is invoked, e.g. a button click. The application can modify this property to control when a gaze enabled UI element gets invoked after a user starts looking at it.
member.returns: The duration for the control to transition from the Fixation state to the Dwell state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetRepeatDelayDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the additional duration for the first repeat to occur. This prevents inadvertent repeated invocation.
member.returns: The additional duration for the first repeat to occur.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetDwellRepeatDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the duration of repeated dwell invocations, should the user continue to dwell on the control. The first repeat will occur after an additional delay specified by RepeatDelayDuration. Subsequent repeats happen after every period of DwellRepeatDuration. A control is invoked repeatedly only if MaxDwellRepeatCount is set to greater than zero.
member.returns: The duration of repeated dwell invocations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetThresholdDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the duration that controls when the PointerState moves to either the Enter state or the Exit state. When this duration has elapsed after the user's gaze first enters a control, the PointerState is set to Enter. And when this duration has elapsed after the user's gaze has left the control, the PointerState is set to Exit. In both cases, a StateChanged event is fired. The default is 50ms.
member.returns: The duration that controls when the PointerState moves to either the Enter state or the Exit state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetMaxDwellRepeatCount(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets the maximum times the control will invoked repeatedly without the user's gaze having to leave and re-enter the control. The default value is zero which disables repeated invocation of a control. Developers can set a higher value to enable repeated invocation.
member.returns: The maximum times the control will invoked repeatedly without the user's gaze having to leave and re-enter the control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.GetIsSwitchEnabled(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Gets a boolean indicating whether gaze plus switch is enabled.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether gaze plus switch is enabled.

member.summary: Sets the status of gaze interaction over that particular XAML element.

member.summary: Sets a boolean indicating whether cursor is shown while user is looking at the school.

member.summary: Sets the size of the gaze cursor radius.

member.summary: Sets the GazeElement associated with an UIElement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetFixationDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the duration for the control to transition from the Enter state to the Fixation state. At this point, a StateChanged event is fired with PointerState set to Fixation. This event should be used to control the earliest visual feedback the application needs to provide to the user about the gaze location. The default is 350ms.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetDwellDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the duration for the control to transition from the Fixation state to the Dwell state. At this point, a StateChanged event is fired with PointerState set to Dwell. The Enter and Fixation states are typically achieved too rapidly for the user to have much control over. In contrast Dwell is conscious event. This is the point at which the control is invoked, e.g. a button click. The application can modify this property to control when a gaze enabled UI element gets invoked after a user starts looking at it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetRepeatDelayDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the additional duration for the first repeat to occur.This prevents inadvertent repeated invocation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetDwellRepeatDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the duration of repeated dwell invocations, should the user continue to dwell on the control. The first repeat will occur after an additional delay specified by RepeatDelayDuration. Subsequent repeats happen after every period of DwellRepeatDuration. A control is invoked repeatedly only if MaxDwellRepeatCount is set to greater than zero.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetThresholdDuration(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the duration that controls when the PointerState moves to either the Enter state or the Exit state. When this duration has elapsed after the user's gaze first enters a control, the PointerState is set to Enter. And when this duration has elapsed after the user's gaze has left the control, the PointerState is set to Exit. In both cases, a StateChanged event is fired. The default is 50ms.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetMaxDwellRepeatCount(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum times the control will invoked repeatedly without the user's gaze having to leave and re-enter the control. The default value is zero which disables repeated invocation of a control. Developers can set a higher value to enable repeated invocation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazeInput.SetIsSwitchEnabled(Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the boolean indicating whether gaze plus switch is enabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazePointerProxy
member.summary:
Helper class that helps track which UIElements in the visual tree are enabled.
The GazePointer is enabled when one or more UIElements in the visual tree have their GazeInput.InteractionProperty value set to Enabled. Notice that there are two conditions for enablement: that attached property is Enabled; that the UIElement is in the visual tree.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.GazePointerProxy.IsLoadedHeuristic(Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: The IsLoaded heuristic for testing whether a FrameworkElement is in the visual tree.

member.summary: A private attached property for associating an instance of this class with the UIElement to which it refers.

member.summary: Method called when the GazeInput.Interaction attached property is set to a new value.
member.param: The element being set. May be null to indicate whole user interface.
The interaction enablement value being set.

member.param: The element proxy is attaching to.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.Interaction
member.summary: This enum indicates the current state of gaze interaction.

member.summary: The state of gaze interaction is inherited from the nearest parent

member.summary: Gaze interaction is enabled

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.Interaction.Disabled
member.summary: Gaze interaction is disabled

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState
member.summary: This enum reflects the states that a user's gaze through while interacting with a control using their eyes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState.Exit
member.summary: User's gaze is no longer on the control

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState.PreEnter
member.summary: For internal use only

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState.Enter
member.summary: User's gaze has entered a control

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState.Fixation
member.summary: User eye's are focused on the control

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState.Dwell
member.summary: User is consciously dwelling on the control with an intent to invoke, e.g. click a button

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.Input.GazeInteraction.PointerState.DwellRepeat
member.summary: User is continuing to dwell on the control for repeated invocation. (For internal use only)

member.summary: This parameter is passed to the StateChanged event.

member.summary: Gets elapsed time since the last state
